description.narrative: Strengthened capacity of EPI programme to manage, maintain and monitor cold chain systems and vaccines supplies annually, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Immunization, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Access to high impact health, nutrition and Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions increased by at least 10 percentage points in four focus districts that have the worst child mortality and malnutrition rates

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL IDENTITY AND CIVIL REGISTR NICR PROJECTS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacity of EPI programme to manage, maintain and monitor cold chain systems and vaccines supplies annually

description.narrative: In 2018, the EPI programme saw marked improvement in the Effective Vaccine Management Assessment (EVMA) composite score from 48% in 2014 to 71% due to implementation of the 2015 improvement plan including procurement and installation of cold chain equipment across health facilities. | Status:Not Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: Months with stockout of measles vaccine at the national level (Target: 0 month)
